law.catch_line: Unlawful access in the third degree.

text.section: A person is guilty of unlawful access in the third degree when he or she, without the effective consent of the owner, knowingly and willfully, directly or indirectly accesses, causes to be accessed, or attempts to access any computer software, computer program, data, computer, computer system, computer network, or any part thereof, which results in the loss or damage of less than three hundred dollars ($300).
Unlawful access to a computer in the third degree is a Class A misdemeanor.

law.history: Created 2002 Ky. Acts ch. 350, sec. 4, effective July 15, 2002.
